articles.title: Are We Finally Not Alone? Webb Detects Life’s Signature on Distant Ocean Planet - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Astronomers may have found the strongest hint of life beyond Earth thanks to new data from the James Webb Space Telescope. They've detected sulfur-based molecules in the atmosphere of exoplanet K2-18b that, on Earth, are only produced by living organisms. Whi…
articles.content: Scientists using JWST have spotted life-linked molecules on a distant exoplanet, matching signs we only see on Earth from living organisms. The evidence isn’t final, but it’s compelling — and could c… [+8929 chars]

articles.author: Elizabeth Rayne
articles.title: Lichens can survive almost anything, and some might survive Mars - Ars Technica
articles.description: The symbiotic organisms appear to be able to avoid some radiation damage.
